definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
-ly/structural particle: used before a verb or adjective, linking it to preceding modifying adverbial adjunct
theatrical work (play, opera, TV series etc)/dramatic (change, increase etc)/acute/severe
negative influence, effect that people's doings or behavior have on others (society)
bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: positive influence, effect that people's doings or behavior have on others (society)
Thucydides trap (theory that war results when a dominant established power fears the rise of a rival power)

definition: circular argument/logical error consisting of begging the question/Latin: petitio principii

definition: Adam Smith (1723-1790), Scottish ethical philosopher and pioneer economist, author of The Wealth of Nations 國富論|国富论
